For serious injury this can basically kill you because you eventually don't have enough blood to keep the heart or brain Alive. This is why you put pressure on a wound or you tourniquet the area so that blood just can't flow to that extremity.  Less severe injuries it means the heart compensates by going faster. For serious injury this can basically kill you because you eventually don't have enough blood to keep the heart or brain Alive. This is why you put pressure on a wound or you tourniquet the area so that blood just can't flow to that extremity.  Less severe injuries it means the heart compensates by going faster.
